body.p: I suspect that the rituals have not changed fundamentally -- whether we call it "downsizing" or "cleaning the stuff" out of the family cave.

So what do you do, practically, with 17 years of collected specs, tech papers, books, slide presentations, recordings, conference proceedings, style guides, and internal user guides – all about OASIS DITA. Oh yes, Dumpster Depot was an option,.but there was also some desire to look back and make some sense of it.

Busking is a great way to gain experience as a musician. It will teach you a lot about what people like, and how to get and keep their attention. It can be hard work, especially if you’re new to it, but it’s worth the effort – you’ll learn to earn more tips and maybe even make new converts out of onlookers. They might end up buying your album or coming to your next show if they like what you’re doing.

What advice would you give to anyone considering the same move?Any aspiring DJ or producer looking to make the move from day job to full-time musician needs to think it through. Make sure the ball is rolling in forward motion and make sure there is momentum and enough money coming in before you leave your day job.
